Regarding Brexanolone, find out the TRUE statement.

options.label: A
options.text: It is a GABA receptor modulator

options.label: D
options.text: Safe in renal disease since excreted by bile and feces

questions.correct_answer: A. It is a GABA receptor modulator
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Why the other options are incorrect? • B. Approved for postpartum psychosis (False) o Fact: Brexanolone is only approved for postpartum depression (PPD), not postpartum psychosis. o Postpartum psychosis requires antipsychotics or mood stabilizers, sometimes hospitalization. • C. Administered orally (False) o Fact: Brexanolone is given as a continuous intravenous (IV) infusion over 60 hours (2.5 days) in a hospital setting. o It is not available in oral form due to rapid metabolism. • D. Safe in renal disease since excreted by bile and feces (False) o Fact: Brexanolone is primarily metabolized by the liver, but it is excreted by both renal and hepatic routes. o Severe renal impairment (eGFR <30 mL/min) can increase drug exposure, making dose adjustments necessary.

options.text: HSG is done to detect the presence of active genital TB

options.label: C
options.text: 6 months of ATT consisting of 2 months of HREZ and 4 months of HR is given for genital TB

questions.text: A 52 years old post-menopausal patient underwent vaginal hysterectomy for uterine prolapse. After 8 days of surgery, she complaint of continuous watery discharge per vaginum with strong smell of ammonia. She had no sensation of full bladder after the surgery. The amount of urine voided normally was reduced. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
A 32 years old P2L2 patient has developed cervicitis. Which of the following kits would be prescribed to her?
A 16 years old girl has primary amenorrhoea with cyclic abdomino-pelvic pain every month. Which of the following is the most likely cause?
Which of the following is a marker of anovulatory cycle?

options.label: A
options.text: Ferning is positive in microscopy of cervical mucous

options.label: C
options.text: Cervical mucous is stretchable beyond 10 cm on day 22

questions.text: A 6 years old girl has developed menarche prematurely. Which of the following is used in the treatment of such cases?
A 57 years old patient has come to gynecology clinic with history of no menopause till now. Which of the following is the next best step in this case?

options.label: C
options.text: Do reassurance if USG pelvis is normal

questions.text: In which of the following clinical scenarios, laparoscopic tubal ligation is not recommended?
Which of the following structure originates from the cranial end of wolffian tubules?
What is the possible karyotype of the following pregnancy?

A Gravida 5 para 4 living 4 patient with 39 weeks of gestation and previous full-term normal deliveries has active labour with face presenting part and mento posterior position. What is the next best line of management?
What must be the cause of the following graph of a patient in labour?
questions.correct_answer: C. APH due to vasa previa

questions.text: A 32 years old pre eclamptic patient who is 8 months pregnant is subjected to fetal monitoring by biophysical profile. Which things are included in it? 1. Fetal respiration 2. Fetal tone 3. Daily fetal kick count 4. Amniotic fluid -SDP 5. NST
Which of the following is a possible cause in a case of recurrent pregnancy losses of first trimester?
A 36 years old P1L1 has a history of DOWN’s syndrome pregnancy in past. Her karyotype revealed Translocation (21,21). What is the likely risk of having DOWN’s syndrome pregnancy again?
Identify the position of the fetus:
A 32 years old primigravida has Hb of 9 gm% with iron deficiency anemia. She is 36 weeks pregnant. Which of the following is not correct regarding this case?

options.label: A
options.text: She must be treated by parenteral iron therapy

options.label: B
options.text: Sr. FERRITIN is the most sensitive test for IDA

questions.correct_answer: D. Erythropoietin level is very low

questions.text: Which one of the following is a contraindication for induction of labour?

options.label: D
options.text: Group B streptococcal screening positive status

questions.text: In a case of partial mole, the surveillance period after HCG becomes negative for 3 weeks is of how many months?
Which of the following is decreased in pre-eclampsia?
Which diameter is being evaluated in the following picture?

A 3-year-old child is brought to the emergency department with symptoms of palpitations and irritability. The child appears stable with a palpable pulse, and normal pulse, but is experiencing a persistent episode of paroxysmal supraventricular tachycardia (PSVT). The child’s vital signs are stable, and there are no signs of heart failure or shock. The electrocardiogram (ECG) confirms the diagnosis of PSVT. Considering that the child is stable, which of the following treatments is the most appropriate initial management for this episode of PSVT?
The patient reports to have another 3 years old sibling at home, who is fully immunized as per the immunization schedule , what is the best measure to prevent it in the siblings of the case child.

options.label: B
options.text: Give full course of DPT vaccine

options.label: D
options.text: Nothing is required to be done

questions.text: A 5-week-old male infant presents to the emergency department after experiencing 2 days of persistent vomiting. The vomit is projectile and yellow, and the infant is unable to tolerate 2-ounce feedings. He has not had any diarrhoea, constipation, or abdominal distension. Despite these symptoms, the infant remains alert and active. His vital signs are as follows: heart rate of 136 beats per minute, respiratory rate of 20 breaths per minute, and blood pressure of 86/52 mm Hg. Examination reveals dry mucous membranes, a capillary refill time of less than 2 seconds, and a non-distended abdomen. The liver edge is palpable 2 cm below the costal margin, and bowel sounds are present. Abdominal ultrasonography shows thickening of the pyloric muscle without other abnormalities. Of the following, the MOST likely laboratory finding in this infant is

options.label: A
options.text: High serum chloride level and metabolic acidosis

options.label: B
options.text: High urine chloride level and metabolic alkalosis

options.label: C
options.text: Low serum chloride level and metabolic alkalosis

options.label: D
options.text: Low urine chloride level and metabolic acidosis

questions.correct_answer: C. Low serum chloride level and metabolic alkalosis

questions.text: A 3-month-old infant is brought to the pediatric clinic with concerns of severe muscle weakness and difficulty with motor skills. The parents report that the baby has been unusually floppy, struggling to hold up his head, and has exhibited poor feeding and lethargy. Additionally, the infant has had episodes of hypoglycemia, characterized by irritability. Physical examination reveals a prominent, enlarged liver, and signs of cardiomyopathy, including an abnormal heart murmur and signs of heart failure. Given the combination of generalized floppiness, cardiomyopathy, and hypoglycemia, further diagnostic evaluations are warranted. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis for this infant?

A 5-year-old child is brought to the pediatric clinic with a history of progressive bowing of the legs and an unusual "windswept" deformities. The parents report that the child has been experiencing difficulty walking and has noticeable lower limb deformities. On evaluation, the child is noted to have a calcium level 9.1mg/dl, phosphorus levels 2mg/dl, and parathyroid hormone (PTH) levels 70pg/ml. Despite adequate calcium intake, the child’s phosphorus levels remain persistently low. Given these findings, what is the most likely diagnosis?
In a 3 months old child with recurrent respiratory infections, which vaccine should not be given?
A 12 years old has history of cyanosis. His X Ray is shown. What is most likely diagnosis?
A 10 yrs old is brought to your clinic. Which vaccine should be given?
A 9 years old boy has recurrent sino-pulmonary infections and greasy stools. Which of the following is commonly seen in the boy?

options.label: D
options.text: Rectal prolapse is most common complication after treatment

questions.text: A mother is worried for her 12 years old daughter. She is short statured as compared to her peers. She has a shield chest and webbed neck. Which of the following is associated with her?

options.label: A
options.text: Pelvic ultrasound showing streak ovaries & hypoplastic uterus

options.label: B
options.text: May be at risk of mitral valve prolapse

questions.correct_answer: A. Pelvic ultrasound showing streak ovaries & hypoplastic uterus

questions.text: A 34-years-old woman landed up in AIIMS emergency after a road traffic accident with GCS-3. She was intubated and sent for NCCT which was found to be normal. What is the most likely diagnosis?
